pull.title: rpc: Add specific error code for "wallet already loaded"
pull.body:
Add a separate RPC error code for "wallet already loaded" to avoid having to match on message to detect this.
Requested by shesek for rust-bitcoinrpc.

If concept ACKed needs:
- [ ]  Release note
- [x]  A functional test (updated the existing test to make it pass, I think this is enough)

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body: Concept ACK per IRC discussion starting from http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2021-01-19.html#l-173

events.message: rpc: Add specific error code for "wallet already loaded"

events.body: This change was part of 22.0, removing "Needs release note".

comments.body:
Maybe set `code` to `RPC_WALLET_ERROR` in default instead of initiliasing it?
```suggestion
            default:
                code = RPC_WALLET_ERROR;
```
What would be the difference? I personally prefer variables to be initialized where they are defined, so that if code later change the risk of introducing undefined behavior is smaller.
No difference, just makes it more clear that by default the error code is RPC_WALLET_ERROR.
